Down jacket, sleeping bag and duffel bag must be returned after completion of the trip) First Aid Medical Kit(Your guide will carry the Medical Kit but we also advise to bring yourself for your own use, as far as possible) All the required permits and paperwork";s:14:"excludes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Excludes";s:13:"cost_excludes";s:417:"International Airfare Visa Charges Hotel Expenses(In Kathmandu, some packages do include hotel expenses) Your travel and medical insurance Personal Expenses such as shopping, bar bills, hot shower, telephone, laundry, titbits etc Food and accommodations in Kathmandu Services not mentioned or not promised by the agent/agency Emergency expenses such as expenses on chartered helicopter.";}s:3:"faq";a:2:{s:9:"faq_title";a:4:{i:0;s:61:"What is the best time of year to take the Elephant Ride tour?";i:1;s:43:"Is the Elephant Ride safe for participants?";i:2;s:46:"What should I wear for the Elephant Ride tour?";i:3;s:46:"How long does the Elephant Ride last each day?";}s:11:"faq_content";a:4:{i:0;s:544:"

The best time to take the Elephant Ride tour is during the dry season, which typically runs from October to March. During this time, wildlife is more easily spotted as animals gather around water sources. The weather is also more comfortable for outdoor activities, with mild temperatures and clear skies. The wet season (June to September) can make travel more challenging due to rain, but it can also offer a lush, vibrant landscape for those who prefer a quieter, more secluded experience.

";i:1;s:540:"

Yes, the Elephant Ride is designed to be safe for all participants. The elephants used in the rides are well-trained and familiar with the route. The rides are accompanied by experienced mahouts (elephant drivers) who have a deep understanding of the animals and their behavior. Additionally, safety equipment such as secure seating and proper instructions are provided to ensure a comfortable and safe experience. Guides are trained in first aid and are always ready to assist if needed.

";i:2;s:467:"

It’s recommended to wear comfortable, light clothing suitable for outdoor activities. Long pants are advised for protection from the sun and possible insects. A hat and sunglasses are also recommended for sun protection. For footwear, sturdy shoes or sandals with good grip are ideal since the terrain can be uneven. It's also a good idea to bring insect repellent and sunscreen to ensure comfort during the ride.

";i:3;s:446:"

Each elephant ride typically lasts around 1.5 to 2 hours, depending on the itinerary and the location. The ride is usually conducted in the morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat of the midday sun, providing the best opportunity to observe wildlife. There may also be additional activities, such as cultural visits, jungle walks, or safari jeep tours, which may extend the day's adventure.

";}}}

item.title: Trishuli River Rafting
item.dc:creator: techteam
item.content:encoded:
The Annapurna Circuit is a trek within the Annapurna mountain range of central Nepal.The total length of the route varies between 160–230 km (100-145 mi), depending on where motor transportation is used and where the trek is ended. This trek crosses two different river valleys and encircles the Annapurna massif. The path reaches its highest point at Thorung La pass (5416m/17769 ft), touching the edge of the Tibetan plateau.

Practically all trekkers hike the route anticlockwise, as this way the daily altitude gain is slower, and crossing the high Thorong La pass is easier and safer. The mountain scenery, seen at close quarters includes the Annapurna Massif (Annapurna I-IV), Dhaulagiri, Machhapuchhre, Manaslu, Gangapurna, Tilicho Peak, Pisang Peak, and Paungda Danda. Numerous other peaks of 6000-8000m in elevation rise from the Annapurna range. The trek begins at Besisahar or Bhulbhule in the Marshyangdi river valley and concludes in the Kali Gandaki Gorge. Besisahar can be reached after a seven-hour drive from Kathmandu.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
a:7:{s:9:"trip_code";s:7:"WTE-272";s:13:"trip_duration";i:15;s:20:"trip_duration_nights";i:14;s:11:"tab_content";a:1:{s:10:"1_wpeditor";s:1268:"

Travel is the movement of people between relatively distant geographical locations, and can involve travel by foot, bicycle, automobile, train, boat, bus, airplane, or other means, with or without luggage, and can be one way or round trip. Travel can also include relatively short stays between successive movements.

The origin of the word "travel" is most likely lost to history. The term "travel" may originate from the Old French word travail, which means 'work'. According to the Merriam Webster dictionary, the first known use of the word travel was in the 14th century.

It also states that the word comes from Middle English travailen, travelen (which means to torment, labor, strive, journey) and earlier from Old French travailler (which means to work strenuously, toil). In English we still occasionally use the words "travail", which means struggle. According to Simon Winchester in his book The Best Travelers' Tales (2004), the words "travel" and "travail" both share an even more ancient root: a Roman instrument of torture called the tripalium (in Latin it means "three stakes", as in to impale).

";}s:9:"itinerary";a:3:{s:15:"itinerary_title";a:4:{i:1;s:50:"Arrival and Introduction to Trishuli River Rafting";i:2;s:46:"First Day of Rafting – Kathmandu to Charaudi";i:3;s:41:"Full Day Rafting – Charaudi to Kurintar";i:4;s:37:"Final Rafting and Return to Kathmandu";}s:20:"itinerary_days_label";a:4:{i:1;s:6:"Day 01";i:2;s:6:"Day 02";i:3;s:6:"Day 03";i:4;s:6:"Day 04";}s:17:"itinerary_content";a:4:{i:1;s:593:"

Arrive in Kathmandu and meet your guide for a detailed briefing on the upcoming adventure. Afterward, enjoy a scenic drive towards the Trishuli River, passing through lush forests, terraced fields, and quaint villages. On arrival, settle into your accommodation, where you’ll have the opportunity to relax and explore the area. In the evening, your guide will introduce you to the basics of rafting, safety measures, and the equipment you’ll use. Enjoy a group dinner to bond with fellow adventurers and prepare for the excitement ahead.

";i:2;s:660:"

After a hearty breakfast, begin your first day of rafting. You will start at the put-in point near Charaudi, where your guide will give you a safety briefing and demonstrate the basic paddling techniques. The rafting journey today will cover approximately 15-20 kilometers, taking you through exciting class II and III rapids. You’ll have opportunities to stop along the riverbank for rest and to take in the spectacular views of the surrounding hills and countryside. In the evening, relax at a riverside camp or lodge, enjoying a well-deserved meal and a chance to reflect on your first day on the river.

";i:3;s:706:"

After a fulfilling breakfast, embark on another thrilling day of rafting. Today’s stretch of the Trishuli River will bring you through a series of more challenging rapids, including Class III+ sections. Your guide will help you navigate through the exhilarating white-water stretches while taking breaks at scenic spots along the way. You’ll also have time to enjoy the natural beauty of the region, with towering hills, dense jungle, and glimpses of local villages. By the afternoon, you will reach the endpoint near Kurintar, where you will spend the night at a comfortable riverside lodge, with time to relax and unwind from the day’s adventure.

";i:4;s:642:"

On your final day of rafting, you’ll enjoy a relaxed morning paddle through calmer waters, allowing you to soak in the last views of the Trishuli River and surrounding landscape. After a final stretch of rafting, you’ll reach your take-out point, where your transport will be waiting to take you back to Kathmandu. The drive back offers a chance to rest and reflect on the experiences of the past few days. Once in Kathmandu, you’ll have some free time for shopping, exploring, or relaxing before your departure, marking the end of your unforgettable Trishuli River rafting adventure.

";}}s:4:"cost";a:4:{s:14:"includes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Includes";s:13:"cost_includes";s:704:"Pick-up or Drop-off service from and to Airport(in our own vehicle) Transportation to and from!! Food all along the trip(Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and a cup of coffee or tea) and accommodations during the trip in hotels with family environment Transportation, food, accommodation and insurance of Guide during the trip Down jacket, all-season sleeping bag, duffel bag and trekking map(in case if you don’t have your own. Down jacket, sleeping bag and duffel bag must be returned after completion of the trip) First Aid Medical Kit(Your guide will carry the Medical Kit but we also advise to bring yourself for your own use, as far as possible) All the required permits and paperwork";s:14:"excludes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Excludes";s:13:"cost_excludes";s:417:"International Airfare Visa Charges Hotel Expenses(In Kathmandu, some packages do include hotel expenses) Your travel and medical insurance Personal Expenses such as shopping, bar bills, hot shower, telephone, laundry, titbits etc Food and accommodations in Kathmandu Services not mentioned or not promised by the agent/agency Emergency expenses such as expenses on chartered helicopter.";}s:3:"faq";a:2:{s:9:"faq_title";a:4:{i:0;s:81:"What level of rafting experience is required for the Trishuli River Rafting tour?";i:1;s:42:"Is the rafting tour safe for first-timers?";i:2;s:55:"What should I bring on the Trishuli River Rafting tour?";i:3;s:53:"How long is the rafting portion of the tour each day?";}s:11:"faq_content";a:4:{i:0;s:519:"

The Trishuli River Rafting tour is suitable for beginners to intermediate rafters. The river offers a mix of Class II and Class III rapids, which are manageable for people with little or no previous rafting experience. However, it’s ideal for those who are physically fit and ready for an adventure. If you're new to rafting, you will receive thorough safety instructions and guidance from experienced guides, ensuring that you feel confident and safe on the water.

";i:1;s:517:"

Yes, the Trishuli River Rafting tour is designed with safety as a top priority. All participants are provided with high-quality safety gear, including life jackets and helmets. Guides are highly experienced, trained in swift-water rescue techniques, and well-versed in the conditions of the Trishuli River. Before each session, you will receive a comprehensive briefing on safety measures and paddling techniques to ensure you are fully prepared for the experience.

";i:2;s:521:"

For the rafting tour, you should bring comfortable, quick-drying clothes, such as a swimsuit and lightweight, moisture-wicking clothing. Water shoes or sandals with straps are ideal for navigating the river. It’s also recommended to bring a waterproof bag for storing valuables, sunscreen, and a hat for sun protection. A towel and extra clothes for after the rafting are also advised. The tour provides all necessary rafting gear, including helmets and life jackets.

";i:3;s:537:"

The rafting portion of the tour typically lasts for 3-4 hours each day, covering different sections of the Trishuli River. On the first day, you will raft for around 15-20 kilometers, with more challenging rapids and scenic spots. On subsequent days, the rafting stretches will vary in difficulty, but each day offers a mix of thrilling rapids and calmer waters for a balanced experience. The total rafting time each day is designed to be manageable and enjoyable for all participants.

";}}}

item.title: Chulu Peak Climbing
item.dc:creator: techteam
item.content:encoded:
The Annapurna Circuit is a trek within the Annapurna mountain range of central Nepal.The total length of the route varies between 160–230 km (100-145 mi), depending on where motor transportation is used and where the trek is ended. This trek crosses two different river valleys and encircles the Annapurna massif. The path reaches its highest point at Thorung La pass (5416m/17769 ft), touching the edge of the Tibetan plateau.

Practically all trekkers hike the route anticlockwise, as this way the daily altitude gain is slower, and crossing the high Thorong La pass is easier and safer. The mountain scenery, seen at close quarters includes the Annapurna Massif (Annapurna I-IV), Dhaulagiri, Machhapuchhre, Manaslu, Gangapurna, Tilicho Peak, Pisang Peak, and Paungda Danda. Numerous other peaks of 6000-8000m in elevation rise from the Annapurna range. The trek begins at Besisahar or Bhulbhule in the Marshyangdi river valley and concludes in the Kali Gandaki Gorge. Besisahar can be reached after a seven-hour drive from Kathmandu.

The origin of the word "travel" is most likely lost to history. The term "travel" may originate from the Old French word travail, which means 'work'. According to the Merriam Webster dictionary, the first known use of the word travel was in the 14th century.

It also states that the word comes from Middle English travailen, travelen (which means to torment, labor, strive, journey) and earlier from Old French travailler (which means to work strenuously, toil). In English we still occasionally use the words "travail", which means struggle. According to Simon Winchester in his book The Best Travelers' Tales (2004), the words "travel" and "travail" both share an even more ancient root: a Roman instrument of torture called the tripalium (in Latin it means "three stakes", as in to impale).

Arrive in Kathmandu, the vibrant capital of Nepal, where you’ll meet your climbing team and guide. Spend the day exploring the city's rich culture, visiting iconic sites like Swayambhunath (the Monkey Temple) and Durbar Square, or shopping for last-minute climbing gear in Thamel. In the evening, attend a pre-climb briefing to review the itinerary, safety measures, and equipment checklist. Enjoy a traditional Nepali dinner while soaking in the excitement for the adventure ahead.

";i:2;s:494:"

Fly to Pokhara, a picturesque lakeside city with breathtaking views of the Annapurna range. From there, take a scenic drive through terraced hills and lush valleys to Chame, the starting point of your trek. Upon arrival, acclimatize to the altitude while exploring the quaint village and enjoying views of the surrounding peaks. Spend the evening preparing for the trekking portion of the climb, resting to conserve energy for the days ahead.

";i:3;s:567:"

Embark on a challenging trek from Chame to Pisang, ascending through pine forests, crossing suspension bridges, and gradually gaining altitude. Along the way, marvel at the ever-changing landscapes, from lush greenery to the stark beauty of the high Himalayas. Pass through traditional villages where you’ll have the opportunity to experience local Gurung and Tibetan-influenced culture. Arrive in Pisang and settle into a teahouse for the night, enjoying hearty local food and the camaraderie of fellow climbers.

";i:4;s:545:"

Trek from Pisang to Chulu Base Camp, a stunning site located in the shadow of the towering Chulu Peak. Spend the day acclimatizing to the high altitude and practicing climbing techniques under the guidance of your expedition leader. You’ll review the use of technical equipment such as crampons, harnesses, and ropes, ensuring you're prepared for the ascent. Enjoy a restful evening with breathtaking views of the Annapurna massif, gearing up for the climb to higher camps in the days ahead.

";}}s:4:"cost";a:4:{s:14:"includes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Includes";s:13:"cost_includes";s:704:"Pick-up or Drop-off service from and to Airport(in our own vehicle) Transportation to and from!! Food all along the trip(Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and a cup of coffee or tea) and accommodations during the trip in hotels with family environment Transportation, food, accommodation and insurance of Guide during the trip Down jacket, all-season sleeping bag, duffel bag and trekking map(in case if you don’t have your own. Down jacket, sleeping bag and duffel bag must be returned after completion of the trip) First Aid Medical Kit(Your guide will carry the Medical Kit but we also advise to bring yourself for your own use, as far as possible) All the required permits and paperwork";s:14:"excludes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Excludes";s:13:"cost_excludes";s:417:"International Airfare Visa Charges Hotel Expenses(In Kathmandu, some packages do include hotel expenses) Your travel and medical insurance Personal Expenses such as shopping, bar bills, hot shower, telephone, laundry, titbits etc Food and accommodations in Kathmandu Services not mentioned or not promised by the agent/agency Emergency expenses such as expenses on chartered helicopter.";}s:10:"trip_facts";a:4:{s:8:"field_id";a:2:{i:17;s:14:"Transportation";i:11;s:16:"Maximum Altitude";}s:10:"field_type";a:2:{i:17;s:4:"text";i:11;s:4:"text";}i:17;a:1:{i:17;s:11:"1-12 people";}i:11;a:1:{i:11;s:8:"Moderate";}}s:3:"faq";a:2:{s:9:"faq_title";a:4:{i:0;s:79:"Do I need prior mountaineering experience to join the Chulu Peak climbing tour?";i:1;s:66:"Is climbing gear provided, or do I need to bring my own equipment?";i:2;s:50:"How is altitude sickness managed during the climb?";i:3;s:67:"How many people are in a group, and what support staff is included?";}s:11:"faq_content";a:4:{i:0;s:382:"

While prior mountaineering experience is not mandatory, participants should have a good level of physical fitness and familiarity with trekking in high-altitude conditions. Basic knowledge of using climbing equipment like crampons, ice axes, and harnesses is beneficial, but training will be provided during the tour at base camp.

";i:1;s:333:"

Basic group equipment such as ropes, tents, and cooking supplies are provided. However, personal climbing gear, including boots, crampons, harnesses, and helmets, should be brought by participants. Rental options are available in Kathmandu for those who do not have their own gear.

";i:2;s:397:"

The itinerary is designed with acclimatization days to reduce the risk of altitude sickness. Guides are trained in recognizing symptoms and will monitor the group closely. Diamox (altitude sickness medication) is optional but recommended. In case of severe symptoms, the itinerary includes provisions for descent to lower altitudes if necessary.

";i:3;s:357:"

Groups are usually kept small, with 6-12 climbers, to ensure safety and a personalized experience. Each group is accompanied by experienced guides, porters, and a cook team. The ratio of guides to climbers ensures proper attention, and porters assist with carrying gear to minimize strain during the trek.

";}}}

Travel is the movement of people between relatively distant geographical locations, and can involve travel by foot, bicycle, automobile, train, boat, bus, airplane, or other means, with or without luggage, and can be one way or round trip. Travel can also include relatively short stays between successive movements.

The origin of the word "travel" is most likely lost to history. The term "travel" may originate from the Old French word travail, which means 'work'. According to the Merriam Webster dictionary, the first known use of the word travel was in the 14th century.

It also states that the word comes from Middle English travailen, travelen (which means to torment, labor, strive, journey) and earlier from Old French travailler (which means to work strenuously, toil). In English we still occasionally use the words "travail", which means struggle. According to Simon Winchester in his book The Best Travelers' Tales (2004), the words "travel" and "travail" both share an even more ancient root: a Roman instrument of torture called the tripalium (in Latin it means "three stakes", as in to impale).

item.title: Tilicho lake Trek
item.dc:creator: techteam
item.content:encoded:
The Annapurna Circuit is a trek within the Annapurna mountain range of central Nepal.The total length of the route varies between 160–230 km (100-145 mi), depending on where motor transportation is used and where the trek is ended. This trek crosses two different river valleys and encircles the Annapurna massif. The path reaches its highest point at Thorung La pass (5416m/17769 ft), touching the edge of the Tibetan plateau.

Practically all trekkers hike the route anticlockwise, as this way the daily altitude gain is slower, and crossing the high Thorong La pass is easier and safer. The mountain scenery, seen at close quarters includes the Annapurna Massif (Annapurna I-IV), Dhaulagiri, Machhapuchhre, Manaslu, Gangapurna, Tilicho Peak, Pisang Peak, and Paungda Danda. Numerous other peaks of 6000-8000m in elevation rise from the Annapurna range. The trek begins at Besisahar or Bhulbhule in the Marshyangdi river valley and concludes in the Kali Gandaki Gorge. Besisahar can be reached after a seven-hour drive from Kathmandu.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
a:7:{s:9:"trip_code";s:7:"WTE-267";s:13:"trip_duration";i:11;s:20:"trip_duration_nights";i:10;s:11:"tab_content";a:1:{s:10:"1_wpeditor";s:1268:"

Travel is the movement of people between relatively distant geographical locations, and can involve travel by foot, bicycle, automobile, train, boat, bus, airplane, or other means, with or without luggage, and can be one way or round trip. Travel can also include relatively short stays between successive movements.

The origin of the word "travel" is most likely lost to history. The term "travel" may originate from the Old French word travail, which means 'work'. According to the Merriam Webster dictionary, the first known use of the word travel was in the 14th century.

It also states that the word comes from Middle English travailen, travelen (which means to torment, labor, strive, journey) and earlier from Old French travailler (which means to work strenuously, toil). In English we still occasionally use the words "travail", which means struggle. According to Simon Winchester in his book The Best Travelers' Tales (2004), the words "travel" and "travail" both share an even more ancient root: a Roman instrument of torture called the tripalium (in Latin it means "three stakes", as in to impale).

";}s:9:"itinerary";a:3:{s:15:"itinerary_title";a:4:{i:1;s:38:"Arrival in Kathmandu and Trek Briefing";i:2;s:28:"Drive to Chame via Besisahar";i:3;s:25:"Trek from Chame to Manang";i:4;s:45:"Acclimatization and Trek to Tilicho Base Camp";}s:20:"itinerary_days_label";a:4:{i:1;s:6:"Day 01";i:2;s:6:"Day 02";i:3;s:6:"Day 03";i:4;s:6:"Day 04";}s:17:"itinerary_content";a:4:{i:1;s:559:"

Upon arriving in Kathmandu, the bustling capital of Nepal, you’ll be welcomed by your trekking team and transferred to your hotel. Spend the day exploring the city’s cultural landmarks, such as the ancient temples of Pashupatinath or Boudhanath Stupa. In the evening, attend a detailed trek briefing where your guide will provide an overview of the route, safety protocols, and equipment checklist. Enjoy a warm welcome dinner featuring traditional Nepali cuisine as you prepare for the adventure ahead.

";i:2;s:529:"

Start your journey with a scenic drive from Kathmandu to Chame, passing through lush green valleys, terraced farmlands, and quaint hillside villages. The road winds alongside the Marsyangdi River, offering glimpses of snow-capped peaks in the distance. Stop for lunch in Besisahar, a vibrant town marking the gateway to the Annapurna region. Upon reaching Chame, a picturesque mountain town, acclimatize to the altitude and enjoy the serene views of the surrounding landscapes.

";i:3;s:584:"

Begin your trek through dense pine forests and along rocky trails, steadily ascending toward the high-altitude town of Manang. The journey offers awe-inspiring views of the Annapurna range and encounters with local villages showcasing the unique Tibetan-influenced culture of the region. As you approach Manang, the terrain becomes more arid and dramatic, reflecting the unique Himalayan climate. Arrive in Manang and settle into a cozy teahouse for the evening, where you can enjoy local meals and rest before continuing your trek.

";i:4;s:642:"

Spend the morning in Manang to acclimatize, exploring nearby monasteries or taking a short hike to gain altitude gradually. After lunch, trek towards Tilicho Base Camp, crossing challenging trails with breathtaking views of rugged cliffs and cascading streams. The route is both thrilling and rewarding, with the towering peaks of Annapurna and Gangapurna keeping you company. Reach Tilicho Base Camp by evening, where you’ll prepare for the next day’s trek to the world’s highest lake, Tilicho Lake. Enjoy a restful night under the stars, surrounded by the grandeur of the Himalayas.

";}}s:4:"cost";a:4:{s:14:"includes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Includes";s:13:"cost_includes";s:704:"Pick-up or Drop-off service from and to Airport(in our own vehicle) Transportation to and from!! Food all along the trip(Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and a cup of coffee or tea) and accommodations during the trip in hotels with family environment Transportation, food, accommodation and insurance of Guide during the trip Down jacket, all-season sleeping bag, duffel bag and trekking map(in case if you don’t have your own. Down jacket, sleeping bag and duffel bag must be returned after completion of the trip) First Aid Medical Kit(Your guide will carry the Medical Kit but we also advise to bring yourself for your own use, as far as possible) All the required permits and paperwork";s:14:"excludes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Excludes";s:13:"cost_excludes";s:417:"International Airfare Visa Charges Hotel Expenses(In Kathmandu, some packages do include hotel expenses) Your travel and medical insurance Personal Expenses such as shopping, bar bills, hot shower, telephone, laundry, titbits etc Food and accommodations in Kathmandu Services not mentioned or not promised by the agent/agency Emergency expenses such as expenses on chartered helicopter.";}s:3:"faq";a:2:{s:9:"faq_title";a:4:{i:0;s:66:"Do I need prior trekking experience to join the Tilicho Lake Trek?";i:1;s:69:"What kind of accommodation can I expect during the Tilicho Lake Trek?";i:2;s:65:"How does the itinerary help with acclimatization during the trek?";i:3;s:101:"How many people are in a typical group, and what kind of support staff will accompany us on the trek?";}s:11:"faq_content";a:4:{i:0;s:472:"

While prior trekking experience is not mandatory, participants should have a good level of physical fitness and be comfortable with multi-day treks at high altitudes. The trek involves challenging terrain and long days of walking, so it's essential to prepare by hiking regularly and building stamina before the trip. Basic knowledge of altitude trekking is helpful, but our guides will assist you every step of the way.

";i:1;s:381:"

Throughout the trek, you will stay in traditional teahouses, offering basic yet comfortable accommodations. Rooms are usually shared, and amenities can be simple, but the hospitality of the local people makes for a memorable experience. Teahouses provide warm meals and offer a chance to interact with fellow trekkers and locals.

";i:2;s:422:"

The itinerary includes built-in acclimatization days, especially in Manang, where you’ll take shorter hikes to higher altitudes before returning to rest. This gradual increase in elevation allows your body to adjust to the thinning air, minimizing the risk of altitude sickness. Our guides are trained to monitor your health and ensure your safety throughout the trek.

";i:3;s:406:"

Groups typically consist of 6-12 trekkers, ensuring a personalized and intimate experience. The trek is supported by an experienced guide, assistant guides, and porters who will carry your gear. A cook team will also be with you, preparing nourishing meals throughout the trek. This team ensures your safety, comfort, and enjoyment every step of the way.

";}}}

Upon arriving in Kathmandu, the bustling capital of Nepal, you’ll be welcomed by your trekking team and transferred to your hotel. Spend the day exploring the city’s cultural landmarks, such as the ancient temples of Pashupatinath or Boudhanath Stupa. In the evening, attend a detailed trek briefing where your guide will provide an overview of the route, safety protocols, and equipment checklist. Enjoy a warm welcome dinner featuring traditional Nepali cuisine as you prepare for the adventure ahead.

";i:2;s:529:"

Start your journey with a scenic drive from Kathmandu to Chame, passing through lush green valleys, terraced farmlands, and quaint hillside villages. The road winds alongside the Marsyangdi River, offering glimpses of snow-capped peaks in the distance. Stop for lunch in Besisahar, a vibrant town marking the gateway to the Annapurna region. Upon reaching Chame, a picturesque mountain town, acclimatize to the altitude and enjoy the serene views of the surrounding landscapes.

";i:3;s:584:"

Begin your trek through dense pine forests and along rocky trails, steadily ascending toward the high-altitude town of Manang. The journey offers awe-inspiring views of the Annapurna range and encounters with local villages showcasing the unique Tibetan-influenced culture of the region. As you approach Manang, the terrain becomes more arid and dramatic, reflecting the unique Himalayan climate. Arrive in Manang and settle into a cozy teahouse for the evening, where you can enjoy local meals and rest before continuing your trek.

";i:4;s:642:"

Spend the morning in Manang to acclimatize, exploring nearby monasteries or taking a short hike to gain altitude gradually. After lunch, trek towards Tilicho Base Camp, crossing challenging trails with breathtaking views of rugged cliffs and cascading streams. The route is both thrilling and rewarding, with the towering peaks of Annapurna and Gangapurna keeping you company. Reach Tilicho Base Camp by evening, where you’ll prepare for the next day’s trek to the world’s highest lake, Tilicho Lake. Enjoy a restful night under the stars, surrounded by the grandeur of the Himalayas.

";}}s:4:"cost";a:4:{s:14:"includes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Includes";s:13:"cost_includes";s:704:"Pick-up or Drop-off service from and to Airport(in our own vehicle) Transportation to and from!! Food all along the trip(Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and a cup of coffee or tea) and accommodations during the trip in hotels with family environment Transportation, food, accommodation and insurance of Guide during the trip Down jacket, all-season sleeping bag, duffel bag and trekking map(in case if you don’t have your own. Down jacket, sleeping bag and duffel bag must be returned after completion of the trip) First Aid Medical Kit(Your guide will carry the Medical Kit but we also advise to bring yourself for your own use, as far as possible) All the required permits and paperwork";s:14:"excludes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Excludes";s:13:"cost_excludes";s:417:"International Airfare Visa Charges Hotel Expenses(In Kathmandu, some packages do include hotel expenses) Your travel and medical insurance Personal Expenses such as shopping, bar bills, hot shower, telephone, laundry, titbits etc Food and accommodations in Kathmandu Services not mentioned or not promised by the agent/agency Emergency expenses such as expenses on chartered helicopter.";}s:3:"faq";a:2:{s:9:"faq_title";a:4:{i:0;s:66:"Do I need prior trekking experience to join the Tilicho Lake Trek?";i:1;s:69:"What kind of accommodation can I expect during the Tilicho Lake Trek?";i:2;s:65:"How does the itinerary help with acclimatization during the trek?";i:3;s:101:"How many people are in a typical group, and what kind of support staff will accompany us on the trek?";}s:11:"faq_content";a:4:{i:0;s:472:"

While prior trekking experience is not mandatory, participants should have a good level of physical fitness and be comfortable with multi-day treks at high altitudes. The trek involves challenging terrain and long days of walking, so it's essential to prepare by hiking regularly and building stamina before the trip. Basic knowledge of altitude trekking is helpful, but our guides will assist you every step of the way.

";i:1;s:381:"

Throughout the trek, you will stay in traditional teahouses, offering basic yet comfortable accommodations. Rooms are usually shared, and amenities can be simple, but the hospitality of the local people makes for a memorable experience. Teahouses provide warm meals and offer a chance to interact with fellow trekkers and locals.

";i:2;s:422:"

The itinerary includes built-in acclimatization days, especially in Manang, where you’ll take shorter hikes to higher altitudes before returning to rest. This gradual increase in elevation allows your body to adjust to the thinning air, minimizing the risk of altitude sickness. Our guides are trained to monitor your health and ensure your safety throughout the trek.

";i:3;s:406:"

Groups typically consist of 6-12 trekkers, ensuring a personalized and intimate experience. The trek is supported by an experienced guide, assistant guides, and porters who will carry your gear. A cook team will also be with you, preparing nourishing meals throughout the trek. This team ensures your safety, comfort, and enjoyment every step of the way.

";}}}

a:7:{s:9:"trip_code";s:7:"WTE-267";s:13:"trip_duration";i:11;s:20:"trip_duration_nights";i:10;s:11:"tab_content";a:1:{s:10:"1_wpeditor";s:1268:"

Travel is the movement of people between relatively distant geographical locations, and can involve travel by foot, bicycle, automobile, train, boat, bus, airplane, or other means, with or without luggage, and can be one way or round trip. Travel can also include relatively short stays between successive movements.

The origin of the word "travel" is most likely lost to history. The term "travel" may originate from the Old French word travail, which means 'work'. According to the Merriam Webster dictionary, the first known use of the word travel was in the 14th century.

It also states that the word comes from Middle English travailen, travelen (which means to torment, labor, strive, journey) and earlier from Old French travailler (which means to work strenuously, toil). In English we still occasionally use the words "travail", which means struggle. According to Simon Winchester in his book The Best Travelers' Tales (2004), the words "travel" and "travail" both share an even more ancient root: a Roman instrument of torture called the tripalium (in Latin it means "three stakes", as in to impale).

item.title: Rocky Mountain Vacations
item.dc:creator: techteam
item.content:encoded:
The Annapurna Circuit is a trek within the Annapurna mountain range of central Nepal.The total length of the route varies between 160–230 km (100-145 mi), depending on where motor transportation is used and where the trek is ended. This trek crosses two different river valleys and encircles the Annapurna massif. The path reaches its highest point at Thorung La pass (5416m/17769 ft), touching the edge of the Tibetan plateau.

Practically all trekkers hike the route anticlockwise, as this way the daily altitude gain is slower, and crossing the high Thorong La pass is easier and safer. The mountain scenery, seen at close quarters includes the Annapurna Massif (Annapurna I-IV), Dhaulagiri, Machhapuchhre, Manaslu, Gangapurna, Tilicho Peak, Pisang Peak, and Paungda Danda. Numerous other peaks of 6000-8000m in elevation rise from the Annapurna range. The trek begins at Besisahar or Bhulbhule in the Marshyangdi river valley and concludes in the Kali Gandaki Gorge. Besisahar can be reached after a seven-hour drive from Kathmandu.

a:7:{s:9:"trip_code";s:7:"WTE-279";s:13:"trip_duration";i:13;s:20:"trip_duration_nights";i:12;s:11:"tab_content";a:1:{s:10:"1_wpeditor";s:1268:"

Travel is the movement of people between relatively distant geographical locations, and can involve travel by foot, bicycle, automobile, train, boat, bus, airplane, or other means, with or without luggage, and can be one way or round trip. Travel can also include relatively short stays between successive movements.

The origin of the word "travel" is most likely lost to history. The term "travel" may originate from the Old French word travail, which means 'work'. According to the Merriam Webster dictionary, the first known use of the word travel was in the 14th century.

It also states that the word comes from Middle English travailen, travelen (which means to torment, labor, strive, journey) and earlier from Old French travailler (which means to work strenuously, toil). In English we still occasionally use the words "travail", which means struggle. According to Simon Winchester in his book The Best Travelers' Tales (2004), the words "travel" and "travail" both share an even more ancient root: a Roman instrument of torture called the tripalium (in Latin it means "three stakes", as in to impale).

";}s:9:"itinerary";a:3:{s:15:"itinerary_title";a:4:{i:1;s:39:"Denver and Rocky Mountain National Park";i:2;s:22:"Boulder and Estes Park";i:3;s:34:"Grand Lake and Hot Sulphur Springs";i:4;s:22:"Aspen and Maroon Bells";}s:20:"itinerary_days_label";a:4:{i:1;s:6:"Day 01";i:2;s:6:"Day 02";i:3;s:6:"Day 03";i:4;s:6:"Day 04";}s:17:"itinerary_content";a:4:{i:1;s:679:"

Arrive in Denver, the gateway to the Rockies, and begin your journey with a scenic drive to Rocky Mountain National Park. Spend the day exploring the park's diverse landscapes, from alpine meadows to rugged mountain peaks. Visit the renowned Trail Ridge Road, the highest continuous paved road in North America, and stop at viewpoints offering breathtaking vistas of the Continental Divide. Take a short guided hike to Bear Lake or Alberta Falls, learning about the area’s flora, fauna, and indigenous history. End the day in the charming mountain town of Estes Park, where you’ll enjoy a cozy evening surrounded by nature.

";i:2;s:625:"

Begin your day in Boulder, a vibrant town at the foot of the Rockies. Visit the Pearl Street Mall to explore local artisan shops and cafes, then head to the Boulder Dushanbe Teahouse, a gift from Boulder’s sister city in Tajikistan, for a cultural and culinary experience. Afterward, return to Estes Park for a visit to the historic Stanley Hotel, inspiration for Stephen King's The Shining. Take a guided tour of the property to learn about its storied past and enjoy the panoramic views of the surrounding mountains before winding down with a relaxing evening.

";i:3;s:591:"

Drive to the picturesque town of Grand Lake, known as the western gateway to Rocky Mountain National Park. Stroll along the charming boardwalk, lined with galleries and boutiques, and take in the views of the sparkling lake framed by towering peaks. Afterward, relax at Hot Sulphur Springs, where you can soak in natural mineral pools that have been used for centuries by indigenous peoples. Learn about the cultural history of the springs before heading to your lodging, where the serene environment will offer an opportunity to recharge.

";i:4;s:623:"

Conclude your journey with a visit to Aspen, one of Colorado’s most famous mountain towns. Explore the elegant streets filled with art galleries and gourmet eateries, then head to the Maroon Bells, often called the most photographed peaks in North America. Take a guided tour to learn about the geology and ecology of the area while enjoying the pristine beauty of its alpine lakes and dramatic landscapes. Wrap up your adventure with a farewell dinner, savoring local flavors as you reflect on your cultural and natural discoveries in the heart of the Rocky Mountains.

";}}s:4:"cost";a:4:{s:14:"includes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Includes";s:13:"cost_includes";s:704:"Pick-up or Drop-off service from and to Airport(in our own vehicle) Transportation to and from!! Food all along the trip(Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and a cup of coffee or tea) and accommodations during the trip in hotels with family environment Transportation, food, accommodation and insurance of Guide during the trip Down jacket, all-season sleeping bag, duffel bag and trekking map(in case if you don’t have your own. Down jacket, sleeping bag and duffel bag must be returned after completion of the trip) First Aid Medical Kit(Your guide will carry the Medical Kit but we also advise to bring yourself for your own use, as far as possible) All the required permits and paperwork";s:14:"excludes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Excludes";s:13:"cost_excludes";s:417:"International Airfare Visa Charges Hotel Expenses(In Kathmandu, some packages do include hotel expenses) Your travel and medical insurance Personal Expenses such as shopping, bar bills, hot shower, telephone, laundry, titbits etc Food and accommodations in Kathmandu Services not mentioned or not promised by the agent/agency Emergency expenses such as expenses on chartered helicopter.";}s:3:"faq";a:2:{s:9:"faq_title";a:4:{i:0;s:87:"What are the main cultural and natural activities included in the Rocky Mountains tour?";i:1;s:57:"What kind of accommodations are provided during the tour?";i:2;s:72:"What is the best time of year to take the Rocky Mountains cultural tour?";i:3;s:76:"How many people are in a group, and what kind of transportation is provided?";}s:11:"faq_content";a:4:{i:0;s:487:"

The tour includes visits to iconic sites such as Rocky Mountain National Park, Trail Ridge Road, and the Maroon Bells. Cultural experiences include exploring historic landmarks like the Stanley Hotel, visiting Boulder’s Dushanbe Teahouse, and learning about indigenous history through guided tours and museum stops. Outdoor activities like hiking, wildlife spotting, and soaking in natural hot springs are also part of the itinerary.

";i:1;s:322:"

Accommodations are typically cozy mountain lodges or 3- to 4-star hotels located in scenic towns such as Estes Park, Grand Lake, or Aspen. These lodgings are selected for their comfort, proximity to key attractions, and ability to offer an authentic mountain experience.

";i:2;s:427:"

The tour operates year-round but offers unique experiences depending on the season. Summer and early fall are ideal for hiking, wildlife spotting, and enjoying lush landscapes, while winter tours provide opportunities for snowshoeing, cozy evenings by the fire, and possibly seeing the Rockies blanketed in snow. Spring tours showcase blooming wildflowers and quieter trails.

";i:3;s:339:"

Group sizes are typically limited to 10-20 participants to ensure a personalized experience. Transportation is provided via a comfortable, air-conditioned coach or minivan for smaller groups. Scenic drives and access to remote locations are planned for maximum convenience and enjoyment.

";}}}

Conclude your journey with a visit to Aspen, one of Colorado’s most famous mountain towns. Explore the elegant streets filled with art galleries and gourmet eateries, then head to the Maroon Bells, often called the most photographed peaks in North America. Take a guided tour to learn about the geology and ecology of the area while enjoying the pristine beauty of its alpine lakes and dramatic landscapes. Wrap up your adventure with a farewell dinner, savoring local flavors as you reflect on your cultural and natural discoveries in the heart of the Rocky Mountains.

";}}s:4:"cost";a:4:{s:14:"includes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Includes";s:13:"cost_includes";s:704:"Pick-up or Drop-off service from and to Airport(in our own vehicle) Transportation to and from!! Food all along the trip(Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and a cup of coffee or tea) and accommodations during the trip in hotels with family environment Transportation, food, accommodation and insurance of Guide during the trip Down jacket, all-season sleeping bag, duffel bag and trekking map(in case if you don’t have your own. Down jacket, sleeping bag and duffel bag must be returned after completion of the trip) First Aid Medical Kit(Your guide will carry the Medical Kit but we also advise to bring yourself for your own use, as far as possible) All the required permits and paperwork";s:14:"excludes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Excludes";s:13:"cost_excludes";s:417:"International Airfare Visa Charges Hotel Expenses(In Kathmandu, some packages do include hotel expenses) Your travel and medical insurance Personal Expenses such as shopping, bar bills, hot shower, telephone, laundry, titbits etc Food and accommodations in Kathmandu Services not mentioned or not promised by the agent/agency Emergency expenses such as expenses on chartered helicopter.";}s:3:"faq";a:2:{s:9:"faq_title";a:4:{i:0;s:87:"What are the main cultural and natural activities included in the Rocky Mountains tour?";i:1;s:57:"What kind of accommodations are provided during the tour?";i:2;s:72:"What is the best time of year to take the Rocky Mountains cultural tour?";i:3;s:76:"How many people are in a group, and what kind of transportation is provided?";}s:11:"faq_content";a:4:{i:0;s:487:"

The tour includes visits to iconic sites such as Rocky Mountain National Park, Trail Ridge Road, and the Maroon Bells. Cultural experiences include exploring historic landmarks like the Stanley Hotel, visiting Boulder’s Dushanbe Teahouse, and learning about indigenous history through guided tours and museum stops. Outdoor activities like hiking, wildlife spotting, and soaking in natural hot springs are also part of the itinerary.

";i:1;s:322:"

Accommodations are typically cozy mountain lodges or 3- to 4-star hotels located in scenic towns such as Estes Park, Grand Lake, or Aspen. These lodgings are selected for their comfort, proximity to key attractions, and ability to offer an authentic mountain experience.

";i:2;s:427:"

The tour operates year-round but offers unique experiences depending on the season. Summer and early fall are ideal for hiking, wildlife spotting, and enjoying lush landscapes, while winter tours provide opportunities for snowshoeing, cozy evenings by the fire, and possibly seeing the Rockies blanketed in snow. Spring tours showcase blooming wildflowers and quieter trails.

";i:3;s:339:"

Group sizes are typically limited to 10-20 participants to ensure a personalized experience. Transportation is provided via a comfortable, air-conditioned coach or minivan for smaller groups. Scenic drives and access to remote locations are planned for maximum convenience and enjoyment.

";}}}

item.title: Greece Tour
item.dc:creator: techteam
item.content:encoded:
The Annapurna Circuit is a trek within the Annapurna mountain range of central Nepal.The total length of the route varies between 160–230 km (100-145 mi), depending on where motor transportation is used and where the trek is ended. This trek crosses two different river valleys and encircles the Annapurna massif. The path reaches its highest point at Thorung La pass (5416m/17769 ft), touching the edge of the Tibetan plateau.

Practically all trekkers hike the route anticlockwise, as this way the daily altitude gain is slower, and crossing the high Thorong La pass is easier and safer. The mountain scenery, seen at close quarters includes the Annapurna Massif (Annapurna I-IV), Dhaulagiri, Machhapuchhre, Manaslu, Gangapurna, Tilicho Peak, Pisang Peak, and Paungda Danda. Numerous other peaks of 6000-8000m in elevation rise from the Annapurna range. The trek begins at Besisahar or Bhulbhule in the Marshyangdi river valley and concludes in the Kali Gandaki Gorge. Besisahar can be reached after a seven-hour drive from Kathmandu.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
a:8:{s:9:"trip_code";s:7:"WTE-281";s:13:"trip_duration";i:8;s:20:"trip_duration_nights";i:7;s:22:"overview_section_title";s:8:"Overview";s:11:"tab_content";a:1:{s:10:"1_wpeditor";s:1268:"

Travel is the movement of people between relatively distant geographical locations, and can involve travel by foot, bicycle, automobile, train, boat, bus, airplane, or other means, with or without luggage, and can be one way or round trip. Travel can also include relatively short stays between successive movements.

The origin of the word "travel" is most likely lost to history. The term "travel" may originate from the Old French word travail, which means 'work'. According to the Merriam Webster dictionary, the first known use of the word travel was in the 14th century.

It also states that the word comes from Middle English travailen, travelen (which means to torment, labor, strive, journey) and earlier from Old French travailler (which means to work strenuously, toil). In English we still occasionally use the words "travail", which means struggle. According to Simon Winchester in his book The Best Travelers' Tales (2004), the words "travel" and "travail" both share an even more ancient root: a Roman instrument of torture called the tripalium (in Latin it means "three stakes", as in to impale).

";}s:4:"cost";a:4:{s:14:"includes_title";s:439:"The Trip Cost IncludesInternational Airfare Visa Charges Hotel Expenses(In Kathmandu, some packages do include hotel expenses) Your travel and medical insurance Personal Expenses such as shopping, bar bills, hot shower, telephone, laundry, titbits etc Food and accommodations in Kathmandu Services not mentioned or not promised by the agent/agency Emergency expenses such as expenses on chartered helicopter.";s:13:"cost_includes";s:704:"Pick-up or Drop-off service from and to Airport(in our own vehicle) Transportation to and from!! Food all along the trip(Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and a cup of coffee or tea) and accommodations during the trip in hotels with family environment Transportation, food, accommodation and insurance of Guide during the trip Down jacket, all-season sleeping bag, duffel bag and trekking map(in case if you don’t have your own. Down jacket, sleeping bag and duffel bag must be returned after completion of the trip) First Aid Medical Kit(Your guide will carry the Medical Kit but we also advise to bring yourself for your own use, as far as possible) All the required permits and paperwork";s:14:"excludes_title";s:22:"The Trip Cost Excludes";s:13:"cost_excludes";s:417:"International Airfare Visa Charges Hotel Expenses(In Kathmandu, some packages do include hotel expenses) Your travel and medical insurance Personal Expenses such as shopping, bar bills, hot shower, telephone, laundry, titbits etc Food and accommodations in Kathmandu Services not mentioned or not promised by the agent/agency Emergency expenses such as expenses on chartered helicopter.";}s:3:"faq";a:2:{s:9:"faq_title";a:4:{i:0;s:63:"What are the key highlights of the Greece cultural travel tour?";i:1;s:66:"What kind of accommodation and transport are provided on the tour?";i:2;s:70:"Are meals included in the tour, and can dietary needs be accommodated?";i:3;s:72:"Can the itinerary be customized for private groups or special interests?";}s:11:"faq_content";a:4:{i:0;s:365:"

The tour includes visits to iconic sites such as the Acropolis in Athens, the ancient ruins of Delphi, the monasteries of Meteora, and the beautiful islands of Santorini and Mykonos. Travelers will also experience local traditions, Greek cuisine, and vibrant cultural festivals if available during the tour dates.

";i:1;s:355:"

Accommodations range from 3-star to 5-star hotels depending on the package chosen. Transport between destinations is provided via a comfortable air-conditioned coach, and ferries or flights are included for island visits. Local guided tours are conducted on foot or via smaller vehicles for convenience.

";i:2;s:290:"

Most tours include daily breakfast and selected dinners. Some packages may also include lunch during excursions. Dietary requirements such as vegetarian, vegan, or gluten-free meals can be accommodated if requested at the time of booking.

";i:3;s:318:"

Yes, private group tours or specialized cultural experiences, such as wine-tasting tours in Crete or historical deep dives into classical ruins, can be arranged. Customization requests should be made in advance, and additional charges may apply based on the changes.

";}}s:9:"itinerary";a:3:{s:15:"itinerary_title";a:4:{i:1;s:36:"Athens - The Heart of Ancient Greece";i:2;s:27:"Delphi – Oracle of Apollo";i:3;s:34:"Meteora – Monasteries in the Sky";i:4;s:29:"Santorini – Sunset Splendor";}s:20:"itinerary_days_label";a:4:{i:1;s:6:"Day 01";i:2;s:6:"Day 02";i:3;s:6:"Day 03";i:4;s:6:"Day 04";}s:17:"itinerary_content";a:4:{i:1;s:583:"

Begin your journey in Athens, the cradle of Western civilization. Start with a guided tour of the Acropolis, marveling at the Parthenon, Erechtheion, and Temple of Athena Nike. Explore the Acropolis Museum, where artifacts bring ancient history to life. Afterward, stroll through Plaka, the charming historic neighborhood filled with narrow streets, neoclassical buildings, and quaint shops. Enjoy a traditional Greek dinner at a taverna, complete with live music and folk dancing, to immerse yourself in the vibrant local culture.

";i:2;s:586:"

Depart for Delphi, nestled on the slopes of Mount Parnassus. Renowned as the ancient world’s center of prophecy, visit the Temple of Apollo and the ancient theater overlooking the valley. Explore the Delphi Archaeological Museum to admire treasures like the Charioteer of Delphi. Afterward, enjoy a leisurely lunch in a nearby village, sampling local delicacies such as lamb with lemon sauce and fresh mountain greens. Conclude the day with free time to wander through the scenic surroundings before returning to your accommodation.

";i:3;s:588:"

Travel to Meteora, a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its awe-inspiring rock formations and centuries-old monasteries perched atop them. Visit two of the six active monasteries, experiencing the tranquility and spiritual significance of these sacred sites. Learn about their history and marvel at their intricate frescoes and manuscripts. After lunch in the nearby town of Kalambaka, spend the afternoon exploring the dramatic landscapes, with photo stops to capture the stunning vistas. Return to your hotel for a relaxing evening.

";i:4;s:561:"

Fly or ferry to Santorini, an island famed for its caldera views and iconic blue-domed churches. Begin with a visit to the archaeological site of Akrotiri, often called the "Pompeii of the Aegean." Continue to a local winery to taste Santorini’s renowned Assyrtiko wine. Spend the afternoon exploring the village of Oia, known for its whitewashed buildings and narrow pathways. End your day by witnessing the world-famous sunset over the Aegean Sea, a perfect finale to your cultural journey through Greece.

";}}}
